title: SVOLT confirms 2nd battery cell plant in Germany
notes:
Location:
- SVOLT is building a new cell factory for the European battery industry in Lauchhammer, Brandenburg, Germany. They have also confirmed factories in the German state of Saarland, near the town of Überherrn, and close to a battery assembly in Heusweiler, also in Saarland.

Capacity:
- The initial capacity of the Lauchhammer site is planned to be 16 GWh, with the potential for expansion in the future.

Investment amounts:
- The investment amounts and subsidies for the project are not specified in the provided information.

Project progress:
- SVOLT is planning to start production in Brandenburg in early 2025. The company aims to repurpose the former wind turbine plant in Lauchhammer, with rebuilding and extension works expected to be necessary. The construction of the Saarland sites is facing delays, with production in Überherrn now expected to start in 2027, four years later than initially announced.

Project type:
- The Lauchhammer project is a repurposing of a former wind turbine plant, making it a brownfield project. The Saarland sites involve construction on existing buildings.

Value chain stages:
- The facility in Lauchhammer is planned to cover cell manufacturing, with the potential for future expansion to cover other stages of the battery manufacturing process.

Note: The information on investment amounts and subsidies is not provided in the given text.

title: SVOLT signs lease for battery factory in Germany
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Saarland, Germany, specifically in Heusweiler and Überherrn.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity for the cell factory in Überherrn was initially announced to be 24 GWh, with operations scheduled to start in mid-2022. However, due to delays, cell production in Überherrn is not expected before 2027.

Investment amounts:
- The specific capital invested in the project or announced as planned investment is not provided in the given information.

Project progress:
- The assembly of battery cells into modules and packs at the Heusweiler site is scheduled to begin in April 2023, with the final completion contractually agreed by mid-2024. The cell factory in Überherrn is significantly delayed, with cell production not expected before 2027.

Project type:
- The project involves the establishment of a new build for the assembly of modules and packs in Heusweiler and the construction of a cell factory in Überherrn.

Value chain stages:
- The facility in Heusweiler is focused on the assembly of battery cells into modules and packs. However, the information does not specify whether cathode and anode manufacturing or cell fabrication are part of the project.

Note: The information does not provide specific details on the investment amounts or subsidies received for the project.

title: SVOLT Lands Its Second Overseas Factory in Germany as It Sprints Towards 600GWh Capacity Target
notes:
Location:
- SVOLT's second overseas factory is located in Germany, with one plant in Heusweiler, Saarland, and the other in Lauchhammer, Brandenburg.
- CATL's second battery factory in Europe is located in the Debrecen Industrial Park, Hungary.

Capacity:
- SVOLT aims to achieve a global total production capacity of 600GWh per year by 2025.
- CATL's second factory in Hungary will have a production capacity of 100GWh per year.

Investment amounts:
- SVOLT's investment in its second European factory in Germany is part of a plan to attain a global total production capacity of 600GWh per year by 2025.
- CATL's second factory in Hungary will involve an investment of around CNY 50.9 billion (EUR 7.34 billion).

Project progress:
- SVOLT's first factory in Germany, located in Heusweiler, Saarland, is still being built and will be used to assemble battery packs once fully set up.
- SVOLT's second factory in Lauchhammer, Brandenburg, will involve transforming a defunct facility that was formerly used to manufacture wind turbines into a battery cell manufacturing site.
- CATL's first factory in Germany, located in the state of Thuringia, is scheduled to commence operation before the end of the year, and its second factory in Hungary will begin its construction phase this year.

Project type:
- SVOLT's second factory in Lauchhammer, Brandenburg, involves transforming a defunct facility into a battery cell manufacturing site.

Value chain stages:
- SVOLT's plants in Germany will cover cell fabrication and module assembly, with the factory in Brandenburg supplying battery cells to the factory in Saarland for assembly and installation of EV battery packs.
